properties.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 1 at 2:22AM MST until January 1 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...High Wind Warning through 3 PM Wednesday for portions of
central and north-central Wyoming...

.A very tight pressure gradient and strong winds just above the
surface are creating strong to high wind across portions of
central and north-central Wyoming today.

* WHAT...West winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts 50 to 60 mph. Locally
higher gusts between 65 and 75 mph are expected near Clark.

* WHERE...Cody Foothills including Highway 120. The strongest
winds will be just south of Cody, and between Clark and the
junction of Highway 120 and the Chief Joseph Highway.

* WHEN...Until 3 PM this afternoon. The strongest winds will occur
through 10 AM, but remain windy all day.

* IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. There is an elevated to
extreme risk for a blow over for light and high profile
vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Please
consider delaying travel if your driving such a vehicle. A few
trees could be downed in the Cody area due to the strong wind.
properties.instruction:
Use caution of travelling. Please keep two hands on your steering
wheel in case of a sudden, strong wind gust. In a parking lot,
park into the wind to minimize the possibility of your car door
hitting another parked vehicle.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
